fact: Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not.
Honey never spoils — archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still edible.
A day on Venus is longer than its year.
The inventor of the microwave appliance only received $2 for his discovery.
There are more fake flamingos in the world than real ones.
The Eiffel Tower can grow more than 6 inches during summer due to heat expansion.
Shakespeare invented more than 1,700 English words.
The world’s largest snowflake on record was 15 inches wide.
The dot over the lowercase 'i' or 'j' is called a tittle.
The average person walks the equivalent of five times around the world in their lifetime.
Oxford University is older than the Aztec Empire.
The Great Wall of China is not a single wall, but a series of fortifications built over centuries.
Napoleon was once attacked by a horde of bunnies.
The shortest war in history lasted only 38 minutes — between Britain and Zanzibar in 1896.
Leonardo da Vinci could write with one hand and draw with the other at the same time.
In Japan, slurping noodles is considered polite and shows appreciation for the food.
India is home to more than 2 million Hindu temples.
In South Korea, it’s common to celebrate a person’s 100th day of life with a special party.
In Finland, there is an annual 'Wife Carrying Championship'.
In Thailand, it’s considered disrespectful to touch someone’s head.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.
A snail can sleep for three years at a time.
Koalas have fingerprints that are almost identical to humans.
A cow-bison hybrid is called a beefalo.
Jupiter’s Great Red Spot is a storm larger than Earth and has raged for at least 400 years.
One light-year is about 5.88 trillion miles.
A day on Mercury lasts 59 Earth days.
Neutron stars can spin 600 times per second.
If you could fold a piece of paper 42 times, it would reach the moon.
